PYFI
  • »
  • CLI
  • View page source

CLI¶

pyfi¶

PYFI CLI for creating & managing PYFI networks

pyfi [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options

--debug¶

Debug switch

-d, --db <db>¶

Database URI

--backend <backend>¶

Task queue backend

--broker <broker>¶

Message broker URI

-i, --ini <ini>¶

PYFI .ini configuration file

-c, --config¶

Configure pyfi

add¶

Add an object to the database

pyfi add [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options

--id <id>¶

ID of object being added

agent¶

Add agent object to the database

pyfi add agent [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>¶

Required

node¶

Add node object to the database

pyfi add node [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>¶

Required

-h, --hostname <hostname>¶

Hostname of the node

plug¶

Add plug to a processor

pyfi add plug [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>¶

Required

-q, --queue <queue>¶

Required Queue name

-si, --socketid <socketid>¶

Socket id

-sn, --socketname <socketname>¶

Socket name

-pi, --procid <procid>¶

Processor id

-pn, --procname <procname>¶

Processor name

privilege¶

Add privilege to the database

pyfi add privilege [OPTIONS]

Options

-u, --user <user>¶

Required

-n, --name <name>¶

Required

processor¶

Add processor to the database

pyfi add processor [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>¶

Required Name of this processor

-m, --module <module>¶

Required Python module (e.g. some.module.path

-h, --hostname <hostname>¶

Target server hostname

-w, --workers <workers>¶

Number of worker tasks

-r, --retries <retries>¶

Number of retries to invoke this processor

-g, --gitrepo <gitrepo>¶

Required Git repo URI

-c, --commit <commit>¶

Git commit id for processor code

-rs, --requested_status <requested_status>¶

The requested status for this processor

-b, --beat¶

Enable the beat scheduler

-br, --branch <branch>¶

Git branch to be used for checkouts

queue¶

Add queue object to the database

pyfi add queue [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>¶

Required

-t, --type <type>¶

Required

Default

direct

Options

topic | direct | fanout

role¶

Add role object to the database

pyfi add role [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>¶

Required

scheduler¶

Add scheduler object to the database

pyfi add scheduler [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>¶

Required

-s, --strategy <strategy>¶

socket¶

Add socket to a processor

pyfi add socket [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>¶

Required

-q, --queue <queue>¶

Required Queue name

-i, --interval <interval>¶

Interval in seconds this socket is triggered

-pn, --procname <procname>¶

Required Processor name

-t, --task <task>¶

Required Task name

task¶

Add task to the database

pyfi add task [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>¶

Required Name of this processor

-m, --module <module>¶

Required Python module (e.g. some.module.path

-c, --code¶

Code flag. reads from stdin.

user¶

Add user object to the database

pyfi add user [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>¶

Required

-e, --email <email>¶

Required

-p, --password <password>¶

Required

agent¶

Run pyfi agent

pyfi agent [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

start¶

Run pyfi agent server

pyfi agent start [OPTIONS]

Options

-p, --port <port>¶

Listen port

--clean¶

Remove work directories before launch

-b, --backend <backend>¶

Message backend URI

-r, --broker <broker>¶

Message broker URI

-c, --config <config>¶

Config module.object import (e.g. path.to.module.MyConfigClass

-q, --queues¶

Run the queue monitor only

-u, --user <user>¶

Run the worker as user

-p, --pool <pool>¶

Process pool for message dispatches

api¶

API server admin

pyfi api [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

start¶

Run pyfi API server

pyfi api start [OPTIONS]

Options

-ip <ip>¶

IP bind address

-p, --port <port>¶

Listen port

db¶

Database operations

pyfi db [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

drop¶

Drop all database tables

pyfi db drop [OPTIONS]

Options

-y, --yes¶

Yes to rebuild without prompting

init¶

Initialize database tables

pyfi db init [OPTIONS]

json¶

Dump the database to JSON

pyfi db json [OPTIONS]

migrate¶

Perform database migration/upgrade

pyfi db migrate [OPTIONS]

Options

-d, --directory <directory>¶

Directory of migration pyfi agent

rebuild¶

Drop and rebuild database tables

pyfi db rebuild [OPTIONS]

Options

-y, --yes¶

Yes to rebuild now

delete¶

Delete an object from the database

pyfi delete [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

processor¶

Delete a processor from the database

pyfi delete processor [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>¶

Required Name of processor being deleted

socket¶

Delete a socket from the database

pyfi delete socket [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>¶

Required Name of socket being deleted

task¶

Delete a task from the database

pyfi delete task [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>¶

Required Name of task being deleted

user¶

Delete a user object from the database

pyfi delete user [OPTIONS]

Options

--id <id>¶

Required ID of user being deleted

listen¶

Listen to a processor output

pyfi listen [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>¶

Required Name of processor

-c, --channel <channel>¶

Required Listen channel (e.g. task, log, etc)

-a, --adaptor <adaptor>¶

Adaptor class function (e.g. my.module.class.function)

ls¶

List database objects and their relations

pyfi ls [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

agent¶

List an agent

pyfi ls agent [OPTIONS]

agents¶

List agents

pyfi ls agents [OPTIONS]

call¶

List details about a call record

pyfi ls call [OPTIONS]

Options

--id <id>¶

ID of call

-n, --name <name>¶

Name of call

-r, --result¶

Include result of call

-t, --tree¶

Show forward call tree

-g, --graph¶

Show complete call graph

-f, --flow¶

Show all calls in a workflow

calls¶

List queues

pyfi ls calls [OPTIONS]

Options

-p, --page <page>¶
-r, --rows <rows>¶
-a, --ascend¶

node¶

List a node

pyfi ls node [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>¶

Required Name of node

-t, --tree¶

Display object tree

-h, --horizontal¶

Vertical tree mode

nodes¶

List queues

pyfi ls nodes [OPTIONS]

plug¶

List a plug

pyfi ls plug [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>¶

Required Name of processor

plugs¶

List agents

pyfi ls plugs [OPTIONS]

processors¶

List processors

pyfi ls processors [OPTIONS]

Options

-g, --gitrepo¶
-m, --module¶
-t, --task¶
-o, --owner¶

queues¶

List queues

pyfi ls queues [OPTIONS]

schedulers¶

List queues

pyfi ls schedulers [OPTIONS]

sockets¶

List sockets

pyfi ls sockets [OPTIONS]

tasks¶

List agents

pyfi ls tasks [OPTIONS]

Options

-g, --gitrepo¶

user¶

List users

pyfi ls user [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>¶

Required

users¶

List users

pyfi ls users [OPTIONS]

workers¶

List workers

pyfi ls workers [OPTIONS]

node¶

Node management operations

pyfi node [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

clone¶

Clone the current virtual environment to the node host –to

pyfi node clone [OPTIONS]

Options

-t, --to <to>¶

Required

proc¶

Run or manage processors

pyfi proc [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options

--id <id>¶

ID of processor

pause¶

Pause a processor

pyfi proc pause [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>¶

remove¶

Remove a processor

pyfi proc remove [OPTIONS]

restart¶

Start a processor

pyfi proc restart [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>¶

resume¶

Pause a processor

pyfi proc resume [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>¶

start¶

Start a processor

pyfi proc start [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>¶

stop¶

Stop a processor

pyfi proc stop [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>¶

scheduler¶

Scheduler management commands

pyfi scheduler [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options

--id <id>¶

ID of processor

-n, --name <name>¶

Name of scheduler

add¶

Add a node to a scheduler

pyfi scheduler add [OPTIONS]

Options

-nd, --node <node>¶

Name of node to add

start¶

Start the default scheduler

pyfi scheduler start [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>¶

Required

-i, --interval <interval>¶

task¶

Pyfi task management

pyfi task [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

run¶

Run a task

pyfi task run [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>¶

(package+function) Name of task to run

-t, --type <type>¶

Type of return data (json, pickle, raw)

-s, --socket <socket>¶

Required Name of socket associated with the task to run

-d, --data <data>¶

String data to pass to the socket’s task

show¶

Show details for a task

pyfi task show [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>¶

Required Name of task to run

-g, --gitrepo¶

update¶

Update a database object

pyfi update [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options

--id <id>¶

ID of object being added

plug¶

Update or move a processor plug

pyfi update plug [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>¶

Required

-q, --queue <queue>¶

Required Queue name

-pi, --procid <procid>¶

Processor id

-pn, --procname <procname>¶

Processor name

processor¶

Update a processor in the database

pyfi update processor [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>¶
-m, --module <module>¶
-h, --hostname <hostname>¶

Target server hostname

-w, --workers <workers>¶

Number of worker tasks

-g, --gitrepo <gitrepo>¶

Git repo URI

-c, --commit <commit>¶

Git commit id for processor code

-b, --beat¶
-r, --requested_status <requested_status>¶
-br, --branch <branch>¶

socket¶

Update a socket in the database

pyfi update socket [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>¶

Required

-q, --queue <queue>¶

Required Queue name

-i, --interval <interval>¶
-pi, --procid <procid>¶

Processor id

-pn, --procname <procname>¶

Processor name

-t, --task <task>¶

Task name

web¶

Web server admin

pyfi web [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

start¶

Run pyfi test web server

pyfi web start [OPTIONS]

Options

-p, --port <port>¶

Listen port

whoami¶

Database login user

pyfi whoami [OPTIONS]

worker¶

Run pyfi worker

pyfi worker [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

start¶

Start a pyfi worker

pyfi worker start [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>¶

Required Name of worker

-p, --pool <pool>¶

Size of worker pool

-s, --skip-venv¶

Skip building the virtual environment
